level.text: The Mayor shall fix the date for the hearing on the petition, and shall notify the petitioner, respondents, and intervenors by mail of the date set for the hearing of the petition and related pleadings.
The Mayor may give such other notice of the proceedings to other persons, as deemed necessary in the Mayor’s discretion.
With the consent of all interested parties, any petition filed pursuant to this chapter may be submitted to the Mayor for determination without a hearing.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Commissioners’ Order No. 54-576, dated March 16, 1954, 5T DCRR §§3.2 and 3.6 (September 21, 1970).
